page.title: 09Chickney, transport
page.content: Buses are the only means of public transport since the rural branch line of the railway is no longer in use. The nearest tailway station to Chickney is Elsenham, about 5 miles away, on the main London to Cambridge line. A bus runs 6 times a day between Cutlers Green, Saffron Walden and Chelmsford. Another one runs every weekday morning to London, via the Thaxted/Broxted road, and returns each evening. Cars are relied upon for all other journeys. Services from the local council include the emptying of dustbins and sceptic tanks. A baker delivers bread to local houses 3 times a week. Milk is delivered every other day from Staines Farm. The milk is supplied by Unigate Dairies. Stansted Airport, 8 miles away is due to be expanded and more fully developed. At present the area is very peaceful.
